column2: 1. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
3. What does this road sign indicate?
column8: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 4. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column4: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column8: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.

column4: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column10: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.

column2: 9. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column6: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column8: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.

column2: 10. Which shape is a warning sign?
11. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column6: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column8: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.

column4: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column8: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.

column2: 13. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column6: watch for this species crossing the road.
column10: be ready to hit a reindeer.

column2: 14. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column6: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column8: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column10: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control

column8: Drive with caution and be ready to stop
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 17. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?

column6: No turns are allowed on this road
